item.title: Errors in this command, help me fix them :D
item.dc:creator: @parkview parkview
item.description:
@parkview wrote:

oo i know what the problem was…your code was ALMOST right. you said

else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("magic"))
 {
if (playerLevel[6] >= 135) { 
	sendMessage("NICE 135 MAGIC!");

}
else if (playerLevel[6] <= 135) {
sendMessage(“Your magic level is lower then 135”);
}

But at the last “}” you had to add another one so it would do }}

and then it works,
THX BIG! couldnt have done it without u!

Read full topic
item.source: Errors in this command, help me fix them :D

item.title: Errors in this command, help me fix them :D
item.dc:creator: @eclipse245 eclipse245
item.description:
@eclipse245 wrote:

else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("magic")) { if (playerLevel[6] >= 135) sendMessage("NICE 135 MAGIC!"); else if (playerLevel[6] <= 135) sendMessage("Your magic level is lower then 135"); }

[code] else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“magic”))
{
if (playerLevel[6] >= 135) {
sendMessage(“NICE 135 MAGIC!”);

else if (playerLevel[6] <= 135) { 
 sendMessage("Your magic level is lower then 135");
 }[/code]

That is all man, If that doesn’t help you, look for similar coding in your source to find the proper format.

Read full topic

item.title: Errors in this command, help me fix them :D
item.dc:creator: @parkview parkview
item.description:
@parkview wrote:

else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("magic")) { if (playerLevel[6] >= 135) { { sendMessage("NICE 135 MAGIC!"); } else if (playerLevel[6] <= 135) { { sendMessage("Your magic level is lower then 135"); } }

Thats my command, and i get like 65 errors, probably due to a bracket. Anyways, what should the code be?!

TY :S
